title: Texas Governor Seeks to Plug Law Enforcement Holes After Mass Shootings
summary: Republican Greg Abbott resists Democrats' calls for a special legislative session to consider new gun regulations. AUSTIN, Texas-Texas Gov. Greg Abbott issued eight executive orders Thursday in response to a pair of recent mass shootings, while resisting legislative Democrats' calls for a special session to consider new gun legislation.

title: Russian Executive Arrested in Italy on U.S. Charges
summary: Justice Department alleges Alexander Korshunov illegally obtained GE Aviation trade secrets. Italian police arrested a top executive of Russia's state-owned aircraft-engine maker on U.S. charges that he tried to steal aviation secrets, the Justice Department said Thursday.

title: Iran to Breach Nuclear Deal Again
summary: Tehran says it is abandoning accord's limits on nuclear research; focus shifts to U.N. General Assembly. Iran said Thursday it would abandon constraints on nuclear research set out in the 2015 nuclear deal, in another violation of the accord that raises the risk of its collapse as Europe pursues efforts to salvage it with sanctions relief for Tehran.

title: No Convictions in Oakland Warehouse Fire That Killed 36
summary: Jury acquits one man, isn't able to reach a verdict on another accused of involuntary manslaughter. OAKLAND, Calif.-A jury acquitted one man and wasn't able to reach a verdict on another accused of involuntary manslaughter for the 2016 warehouse fire here that took the lives of 36 people.

title: Beijing, Brexit and Pushing It Too Far
summary: Everyone making decisions grew up in the past 60 years and thinks wealth and stability are normal.. This is on the danger of pushing it too far. It is a delicate business knowing what the moment will allow. You can be right in intent and wrong on execution, and if you're wrong on that it may not matter you were right in intent. A great woman in business and the arts once told me the most dangerous place to be is significantly ahead of the curve. People will dismiss you as too far out. Better to be just a little ahead of the curve, which allows people to wonder if you might be a visionary. She in fact was a visionary, and careful not to seem too many steps ahead.

title: Prudential to Pay $2.35 Billion for Online Startup
summary: Largest insurer by assets expects three-year-old company to help it draw middle-class customers. Prudential Financial Inc. agreed to pay $2.35 billion for an online startup as traditional life insurers seek to reach digital-savvy customers who shop on the internet.

title: A Dollar for Argentina
summary: Argentines prefer to hold greenbacks. Why not bury the peso?. Argentina is back in the soup, as it so often is. The prospect that Peronists might retake power has Argentines fleeing the peso for dollars, and on Monday the center-right government of President Mauricio Macri imposed capital controls. Here's a better idea: Replace the peso with the U.S. dollar as Argentina's legal tender.

title: Greg Craig Gets His Reputation Back
summary: The Democrat was unjustly caught up in the Mueller mania.. A federal jury acquitted Greg Craig this week on charges related to the Foreign Agents Registration Act (FARA), in what ought to prompt some soul-searching at the Department of Justice. This is another example of a special counsel run amuck.

title: Another Payoff for Ethanol
summary: Trump hasn't figured out that this lobby won't stay bought.. The damage from President Trump's trade war is compounding, and so are the political and policy complications. The President is pondering more sops to the ethanol lobby to placate farmers who are angry about his tariffs. Better to fix trade mistakes than to double the harm by genuflecting to Lord Corn.

title: Walgreens, CVS Ask Customers to Stop Carrying Guns
summary: Pharmacy chains and grocer Wegmans announce shift days after Walmart tightened its policies. Drugstore chains CVS Health Corp. and Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. and grocer Wegmans Food Markets Inc. on Thursday asked customers to stop openly carrying firearms in stores, adding to a growing list of companies that are wading into the debate around how to reduce gun violence.

title: Policy Debates Whirl on First Day of School in New York City
summary: Mayor debates gifted-and-talented test as some 1.1 million students return to classrooms in the largest U.S. school system. Visiting schools to mark the first day of classes, Mayor Bill de Blasio called New York City's test that determines gifted-and-talented kindergarten placements a "real concern."

title: Data-Center Landlord Equinix Touts Going Green
summary: Environmental sustainability helps attract customers and employees, CEO says. Renewable energy is top of mind for Charles Meyers, chief executive of data-center landlord Equinix Inc., he said, in part because environmental sustainability helps attract customers and talent.

title: Progressives Keep Calm in the Trump Era
summary: The unhinged hatred comes mostly from centrist Democrats.. Many presidents provoke personal animus beyond opposition to their policies. Ronald Reagan inspired angry punk songs. George W. Bush drove Democrats to distraction. (I still occasionally contribute to a Bush-era website called Smirking Chimp.) Bill Clinton and Barack Obama each evoked conspiracy theories on the far right.

title: Longtime Apple Agency Creative Sues Ad Agency TBWA for Age Discrimination
summary: TBWA says allegations are without merit. Duncan Milner, a creative executive who worked on some of the most famous ads for Apple Inc., is suing advertising agency TBWA Worldwide Inc. and various agency executives alleging age discrimination.

title: The Left's Lucrative Nonprofits
summary: 'Powerful interests' and 'dark money' are mostly on the Democratic side.. This year's Democratic presidential candidates have a favorite whipping boy: "powerful interests." Get ready to hear again in coming weeks how the National Rifle Association rules Washington, how the Koch empire dominates politics, how the right is pouring "dark money" into its agenda. And then remember that these are among the biggest whoppers of the 2020 election. One side will do battle with the aid of a huge and savvy nonprofit political empire-and it isn't the right. Though the sooner Republicans understand that, the better.

title: The Life of a Rabbi With ALS
summary: The father of seven communicates only with his eyes, yet he's still a prolific author.. Rabbi Isaac Hurwitz is as much a rock star as a Hasidic Jew can be. He writes regular Torah commentary for L'Chaim, a weekly newsletter distributed to schools and shuls run by the Orthodox Jewish movement Chabad. One of his songs was made into a widely shared YouTube music video. Rabbi Yitzi, as he's known, also runs a marriage blog that advises men how to be better listeners and partners. He welcomes countless scholars, students and friends to his home in West Hollywood, Calif., to chat, study, pray or play guitar.

title: 'The Life of Charles Stewart Mott' Review: Company Man
summary: Charles Stewart Mott joined the board of General Motors in 1913 and was still running for re-election in 1972, at age 96.. Charles Stewart Mott never had his name on an American automobile, but he was on intimate terms with most of the men who did (he was godfather to Walter Chrysler's daughters). He was also crucial to the rise and success of General Motors. Born in 1875 in Newark, N.J., Mott during his long life amassed a mighty fortune, most of which he spent on good works. He is entirely worthy of the lively, engaging and sympathetic portrait Edward Renehan has drawn in "The Life of Charles Stewart Mott: Industrialist, Philanthropist, Mr. Flint."

title: Trump Administration Expedites Challenge to California on Auto-Emission Rules
summary: Move comes as White House seeks to ease requirements originally set under the Obama administration. The Trump administration is pressing regulators to accelerate the rollout of new tailpipe-emission rules, an attempt to strike back at California for cutting a side deal with several auto makers to set standards that are tougher than those proposed by the administration, according to people familiar with the White House's plans.

title: WeWork Weighs Slashing Valuation by More Than Half
summary: CEO Neumann met with SoftBank's Son last week to discuss more investment. WeWork's parent company is exploring a dramatic reduction in its valuation as it aims to go public while facing widespread skepticism over its business model and corporate governance, according to people familiar with the company's listing plans and its recent talks with major investors.

title: End Nationwide Injunctions
summary: The Dreamers case shows how willful courts can ruin the chance for political compromise.. When a federal court issues an order against enforcement of a government policy, the ruling traditionally applies only to the plaintiff in that case. Over the past several decades, however, some lower court federal judges have increasingly resorted to a procedural device-the "nationwide injunction"-to prevent the government from enforcing a policy against anyone in the country. Shrewd lawyers have learned to "shop" for a sympathetic judge willing to issue such an injunction. These days, virtually every significant congressional or presidential initiative is enjoined-often within hours-threatening our democratic system and undermining the rule of law.

title: India Diminishes Itself as an Alternative to Beijing
summary: New Delhi makes a grave mistake in jeopardizing the religious pluralism that sets it apart from China.. Could an India that actively discriminates against religious minorities still be a close partner with the U.S.? Many Indians point to their country's strategic significance and economic heft to argue that it could. They're mistaken.

title: Launch a Pre-Emptive Strike Against Recession
summary: Congress can blunt the effects of the next downturn by tying spending increases to the unemployment rate.. President Trump was right to set aside premature plans for fiscal stimulus last month. Based on the current economic situation, stimulus isn't yet warranted-but it may be soon. Given the uncertainty, Congress should pass a law immediately that would automatically trigger stimulus if the labor market deteriorates, with unemployment rising rapidly. The package should include not only tax cuts but also relief for states, as well as extra help for people most hurt by recessions. The legislation should be permanent, the measures lasting as long as needed in the next downturn and set to trigger in future ones as well.

title: MTA Union Calls for Rally as Contract Negotiations Intensify
summary: Late October rally in lower Manhattan could 'stop traffic and cause havoc,' it says. The Metropolitan Transportation Authority's largest union is threatening a large rally that will halt traffic in lower Manhattan unless the state-controlled authority softens its contract proposal for subway and bus workers.

title: Executives' Optimism in U.S. Economy Hits Three-Year Low
summary: CFOs, CEOs and controllers lower expectations for profit growth and expansion plans. Finance executives' faith in the U.S. economy has reached a three-year low amid concerns over higher tariffs and economic uncertainty.

title: Hurricane Dorian Lashes East Coast, Bahamas Reel
summary: Powerful storm is causing flooding, tornadoes and power outages as it moves north. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Fannie and Freddie Reform Plan Gets an Incomplete
summary: Treasury Department's plan for the housing giants is vague on key details such as how they will be recapitalized. America's mortgage-finance system isn't going to change in a fundamental way for the foreseeable future. That is the inescapable-though to many parties deeply disappointing-takeaway from the U.S. Treasury Department's housing reform plan issued Thursday afternoon.

title: Government Bonds Fall After U.S. and China Plan New Trade Talks
summary: Yields rise in the U.S., Germany, Japan, Australia and the U.K.. Government-bond yields around the world climbed after signs of a thaw in trade relations between the U.S. and China and a series of reports suggested a healthy U.S. economy.

title: Danske Bank Lures Commerzbank CFO to Deal With Higher Costs, Regulatory Probes
summary: Commerzbank AG, Germany's second-largest bank, to identify a new finance head before Stephan Engels departs. Danske Bank A/S on Thursday replaced its chief financial officer, a move that comes as the Danish lender continues to deal with a money-laundering scandal.

title: Hedge Fund Loses $1 Billion in One Month on Argentina Bet
summary: Autonomy Capital's founder, Robert Gibbins, is known for making concentrated investments. Hedge fund Autonomy Capital lost about $1 billion last month largely on investments tied to Argentina, making it one of the most prominent investors caught on the wrong side of market turmoil in that country.

title: NRA, GOP Lawmakers Back Gun Maker in Newtown Case
summary: Families of victims killed during the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting are suing Remington. Republican lawmakers and gun-rights groups are showing support for Remington Outdoor Co. as the U.S. Supreme Court prepares to decide whether the gun maker can be held liable for the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting.

title: Trump Administration Aims to Privatize Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac
summary: After years of bipartisan talk of abolishing the firms, Treasury launches process to diminish government control over time. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration said it would support returning mortgage-finance giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to private hands, a development that could keep the companies at the center of the housing market for decades to come.

title: Lululemon Athletica Boosts Fiscal-Year Outlook
summary: Profit and net revenue in second quarter increase. Retailer Lululemon Athletica Inc. boosted estimates for revenue and earnings for the fiscal year.

title: Meredith Shares Plunge on Disappointing Outlook
summary: Magazine publisher forecasts earnings for coming fiscal year well short of analyst expectations. Shares in Meredith Corp. fell sharply after the publisher of People, Better Homes & Gardens and Real Simple said it expected to generate significantly less profit in the coming year than analysts had projected.

title: Precious Metals Enjoy Resurgence in Negative-Yield World
summary: Investors seek assets that can hold their value in troubled times. Investors are piling into precious metals at the fastest clip in years, driven by a plunge in global bond yields that has fueled a search for assets that can hold their value during troubled times.

title: Stocks Rally on Plan for New Trade Talks
summary: Dow industrials jump nearly 400 points after U.S. and China said they would hold talks in October. U.S. stocks and government-bond yields lurched higher Thursday after the U.S. and China said they would hold talks in Washington in October, reigniting hopes for an eventual trade truce.

title: Jewelry Retailers Bring Back Shine, but Hurdles Remain
summary: Signet Jewelers is making efforts to reduce costs and improve its e-commerce operations. Some struggling jewelry retailers have taken on a new shine.

title: The Most Promising Careers of the Next Decade
summary: The Wall Street Journal used wages and projected annual demand to rank more than 800 jobs. Tech, management and health-care roles are among the most promising careers of the next decade, according to a Wall Street Journal ranking of new employment-projection data released by the Labor Department. Factory jobs and other manual-labor occupations continue to have the least promising futures.

title: Music Revenue Surges on Streaming Subscription Growth
summary: Paid streaming services added more than one million new subscriptions a month in first half of year. Revenue from recorded music in the U.S. rose 18% to $5.4 billion in the first half of the year, driven by growth in subscriptions to streaming services like the ones offered by Spotify Technology SA, Apple Inc. and Amazon.com Inc.

title: Facebook Rolls Out Dating Feature in U.S.
summary: Matchmaking service expected to compete with established online-dating platforms. Facebook Inc. is bringing its dating service to the U.S. after launching it in roughly 20 countries since last year.

title: 'The Spy' Review: A Life Undercover
summary: Sacha Baron Cohen stars as Eli Cohen in Netflix's gripping drama about the Mossad agent.. When Eli Cohen-known in Syria only as Kamel Amin Thaabet, wealthy businessman and Syrian patriot-was convicted of spying for Israel and hanged in Marjeh Square, Damascus, in 1965, the street crowds roared in triumph. But for many in the high government and society circles who had admired and looked up to him as Thaabet-a wise friend, adviser, impassioned advocate for the Syrian nation and its military, and host of lavish parties-this was not an occasion for joy. As "The Spy" (on Netflix Friday) makes clear in this nailbiter of a saga powered by a dazzling Sacha Baron Cohen in the role of the legendary Israeli agent, there is always the matter of the lives the spy touches in such a case: that of the world in which he's successfully settled, of the bonds of strong friendship established over time and inevitably-necessarily-betrayed.

title: Transform Your Kitchen From Staid to Modern With This One Move
summary: Interior designers are giving a home's most important room instant personality by hanging kitchen-island pendants that don't match exactly. TASKED WITH resuscitating the cookspace of a late-1980s English Tudor near Indianapolis, Tom Stringer found standard-issue pendant lighting too dim-aesthetically speaking. "We do a lot of multiples over islands, and after a while you get bored of three or four of the same thing," the Chicago designer said. The antidote: handblown topaz glass fixtures by John Pomp Studios in sundry shapes. The unexpected array dangles a note of art-studio cool over the space, which otherwise features quartz countertops, white cabinetry and a pair of buttoned-up Jacobean stools.

title: At Telluride, Shifting, Glittering Sands
summary: The 46th Telluride Film Festival, historically devoted to films shown in theaters, was dominated by movies made for streaming.. Telluride, Colo.

title: The Raiders' Antonio Brown Saga Is Only Getting Weirder
summary: Brown may face a team-imposed suspension after a confrontation with Oakland brass, capping a bizarre off-season saga. There's one story captivating the entire NFL right now. It involves frozen feet, an old helmet, a hot air balloon and the most productive wide receiver in the league.

title: Decoding a Smoky Italian Drink
summary: Author Monique Truong reads into Amaro Sfumato Rabarbaro, an Italian liqueur with an intriguing flavor and an evocative name. "I WAS SENT AN AMARO!"

title: Insurers Pitch New Ways to Pay for Million-Dollar Therapies
summary: Cigna and CVS Health are developing new programs to help employers afford gene therapies that can cost more than $2 million. Insurers are scrambling to blunt the expense of new drugs that can carry prices of more than $2 million per treatment, offering new setups aimed at making the cost of gene therapies more manageable for employers.

title: Bank of Canada Official Says No Rate Cut Needed Now
summary: But global trade conflicts remain biggest risk to central bank's forecast. OTTAWA-Canada doesn't require an immediate interest-rate cut, a senior Bank of Canada official said Thursday, despite headwinds the economy is facing from an escalation in global trade conflicts, which could drag on longer than originally anticipated.

title: NFL Signs Content and Advertising Deal With Reddit
summary: League will take questions in a series of 'Ask Me Anything' online town halls. The National Football League is adding Reddit Inc. to its roster of digital marketing channels as its new season begins, hosting a series of "Ask Me Anything" discussions on the platform as part of a broader content and advertising deal.

title: Freight-Matching Startup Loadsmart Adds $19 Million from Maersk, Ports America
summary: Funding round will help the company add staff as it rolls out a service aimed at moving goods more quickly from U.S. ports into distribution channels. Container shipping giant A.P. Moeller-Maersk A/S and Ports America, the largest terminal operator in the U.S., are investing in a digital freight-booking service aimed at speeding the flow of cargo through maritime gateways.

title: Trump's Lead Negotiator on Arab-Israeli Peace Plan to Exit
summary: Jason Greenblatt previously worked for the Trump Organization for two decades. WASHINGTON-President Trump's lead negotiator on his highly anticipated Arab-Israeli peace plan will be leaving the White House soon, throwing further into question the administration's efforts to resolve the decades-old Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: Struggling to Sleep? Try These Bedtime-Story Apps
summary: If anxious thoughts keep you awake at night, these apps and podcasts for adults-which feature bedtime tales read by soothing voices-might help you slumber like a kid again. FOR DECADES, I'VE BEEN among the 35.2% of adults restlessly failing to get the recommended seven hours each night. I've tried burying myself under a weighted blanket and misting my room with sleep-inducing essential oils. My white-noise machine is no match for the blare of New York City traffic that only seems to grow more intrusive after sunset.

title: Treasury to Sell $193 Billion in Debt
summary: U.S. Treasury Department next week will auction $108 billion in new debt and $85 billion in previously sold debt. The U.S. Treasury Department will auction $193 billion in securities next week, comprising $108 billion in new debt and $85 billion in previously sold debt. Details (all with minimum denominations of $100):

title: Copper Extends Rebound on Optimism About Trade
summary: Industrial metal stabilizes after hitting new multiyear low earlier in the week. Copper prices rallied Thursday, bringing their two-day climb to 4.5% on hopes that coming trade talks could relieve some pressure on the global economy.

title: Can a Nation of Soccer Fans Learn to Love Baseball?
summary: Venezuelan refugees boost baseball in Peru. 'They didn't really know what was going on, but they liked it'. LIMA, Peru-Venezuelans fleeing their country's economic collapse have brought an export that is baffling this soccer-mad nation: baseball.

title: Seize the Final Days of Peak Grilling With This Simple Steak Recipe
summary: From the masters of understated elegance at Canal House, this flank steak comes with a side of charred eggplant scattered with fresh mint. IT TAKES EXPERIENCE to know when to leave a dish alone. The food writer-photographer team Melissa Hamilton and Christopher Hirsheimer have cultivated their signature style of gorgeous artlessness over years of working in tandem. This summer they moved their studio, Canal House, to a larger space in Milford, N.J., and opened a restaurant on the ground floor. Their latest cookbook, "Canal House: Cook Something" (Sept. 10, Voracious), distills their approach down to 300 essential recipes. "We follow a really beautiful Quaker quote," Ms. Hirsheimer said. " 'Proceed as the way opens.' And that's what we do."

title: PG&E's Long Record of Run-Ins With Regulators: A 'Cat and Mouse Game'
summary: Over more than two decades, the California utility has at times misled regulators, withheld data and hindered investigations-accumulating fines and judgments of $2.6 billion. SAN FRANCISCO-The company had several warnings.

title: Truckers Are Waiting Longer at Customer Docks, Study Finds
summary: The delays known as detention time expanded last year over 2014 even as companies struggled to find trucking capacity. Truckers are spending more time waiting at the loading dock, leading to delays that cut into earnings of trucking companies and drivers and, ultimately, add to consumer costs.

title: PG&E Penalties and Settlements Through the Years
summary: The California utility has paid more than $2.6 billion in the past 23 years in penalties and lawsuit settlements. PG&E Corp. has paid more than $2.6 billion in the past 23 years in state and federal penalties and lawsuit settlements in matters where the allegations included what might be regarded as lapses in corporate integrity.

title: U.K. Lawmakers Argue Over Timing of Vote
summary: Row over when to hold a general election comes after Parliament moves to prevent a no-deal Brexit. LONDON-British political leaders argued over when to hold a snap election, a vote they hope will break a stalemate over when and how the country splits with the European Union-but one that might yield no clear winner.

title: Michigan State Fined $4.5 Million for Crime-Reporting Failures
summary: Record fine by Education Department follows Larry Nassar abuse scandal. Michigan State University must pay a record $4.5 million fine to the U.S. Education Department for violating federal crime-reporting guidelines and failing to protect students in relation to sex abuse by former sports-medicine doctor Larry Nassar.

title: Even Statist France Gave Up on Wealth Tax
summary: If any of the Democratic proposals to tax assets becomes law, watch out for your home and 401(k)/IRA.. Legislating a wealth tax, as advocated by a number of Democratic presidential candidates, will only trigger a more creative definition of what constitutes "wealth," and then the gaming will begin ("Democrats' Idea: Tax Wealth, Not Just Income," Page One, Aug. 28). We have already seen this with the definition of income. For example, many private-equity and hedge-fund financiers use carried interest to lower their tax liability by paying the lower capital-gains tax rate on much of their income instead of the higher income-tax rate paid by wage earners.

title: California Merges Mileage, Emissions Rules
summary: What's happening now is California is trying to use its waiver for emission standards to break away and set its own, separate fuel-economy standards.. Regarding Holman Jenkins's "The California War Is About EVs" (Business World, Aug. 28): What the Trump administration is trying to do is reduce fuel-economy targets, aka the Corporate Average Fuel Economy (CAFE) regulations. These were created in the 1970s in an attempt to counteract the impact of oil supply reductions and increased prices. Today the need for such standards at all is questionable as the U.S. is close to self-sufficiency in oil due to innovations like fracking and reliable supplies from Canada and Mexico.

title: Trump's China Policy Is Unorthodox for a Reason
summary: Jason Furman is wrong for suggesting President Trump should continue the same failed China policy conducted by past presidents, whose trade appeasement only emboldened Chinese cheating.. Jason Furman is wrong for suggesting President Trump should continue the same failed China policy conducted by past presidents, whose trade appeasement only emboldened Chinese cheating ("Trump Is Losing the Trade War With China," op-ed, Aug. 20). Trump administration and Chinese negotiators met multiple times but China kept delaying. President Trump's policy is correct, which is why several Democrats support it.

title: Trade Uncertainty Likely to Cut U.S. Growth by More Than 1%, Fed Says
summary: Economists charted certainty with text analyses of newspaper articles, corporate-earnings calls. Uncertainty over trade policy is likely to reduce U.S. economic output by more than 1% through early 2020, new research from Federal Reserve economists suggests.

title: Kroger Enters Meatless Fray with Store-Branded Patties
summary: Grocer adds pea-based meat replacements, expands digital operations as competition mounts. Kroger Co. is jumping into the meatless business.

summary: Resume Subscription. When Hurricane Dorian struck the Bahamas early Sunday, it was the strongest storm on record to hit the archipelago's northwestern islands. And then it stalled, hovering for nearly three days.

title: Let's Bring Back the Proper Snack
summary: Eating between meals doesn't have to be a vice, as long as we give our snacks the attention they deserve. "Don't eat between meals" was the stern old advice, spoken to ravenous children. I am old enough to remember these warnings against snacks and recall feeling puzzled by the logic. Why was it OK to eat a slice of toast as part of breakfast but not OK to eat the exact same toast during a peckish hour in the afternoon?

summary: A behavioral economist answers questions on making friends, sliding-scale pricing and buying a new car.

summary: Kerfuffle over Trump's use of weather map draws attention to marker, but its maker shouldn't push its luck. You can't make this up.

title: A Runner's Guide to Touring Angkor Wat and Beyond
summary: On a trip through Southeast Asia-from Angkor Wat to Singapore-a restless wanderer starts each morning with a run, stopping for snacks and sightseeing. Plus: Guided running tours that include coaches and chilled coconut water. ANGKOR WAT, Cambodia's prized tourist destination, receives over 2.5 million visitors a year. Sometimes, at dawn, it can feel like a million of them are right there next to you, disembarking from tour buses, jostling for photo ops, feeding the cheeky monkeys who inhabit the ruins, and acknowledging the beauty of the sunrise in one of many foreign languages constantly spoken here. It's the kind of mass tourism that makes me want to run away fast. On this Angkor Wat dawn, though, my escape is not just metaphorical. I'm literally jogging away from these visitors, guided by my own running coach. We're on a program devised by the Anantara Angkor Resort, located in the adjacent town of Siem Reap, which offers guests running tours of the temples. These morning tours are offered for solo runners or small groups, and the hotel provides a driver and vehicle to follow us, a range of drinks and snacks, and a running coach, for $100 per person.

title: Readers Reflect on Lessons Learned While Building Their Own Homes
summary: 'Counting House' columnist Beth DeCarbo tackled everything she wished she'd known before building her first home. Here's how Mansion readers responded. In the Counting House column on Aug. 2, Beth DeCarbo shared "The Five Things I Wish I'd Known Before I Built My House." Readers had a lot to say on the matter. title: U.S. Service-Sector Activity Picked Up in August
